abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Karnataka Panchayats
            Strengthening Project for India were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            Strong, top-down state commitment and action is critical to
            the success of decentralization and this block grants plus
            capacity building approach. The approach of discretionary
            block grants complemented by capacity building has proved
            its potential, even if it may require modification to
            continue having strong impacts. It is critical that the
            M&E and management information system of
            decentralization projects are more robust and well thought
            through, even if this is challenging for this type of
            project. It is important to have a performance assessment
            system that has good enough standards of accountability but
            that is also realistically tailored to the existing
            capacities of GPs in the backward areas. Capacity building
            efforts would need to be better tailored and more
            appropriately targeted and rolled out if the full potential
            of the block grant system is to be realized. It is important
            to ensure that the GP plans and their implementation
            sufficiently reflect changing constituent preferences and
            the interests of the more excluded groups. Improved
            information and education campaigns could contribute to the
            strengthening of the GP planning, resource management and delivery.
